title: Three judges to rule on whether Scottish court should send letter requesting Brexit extension
text:
Three judges will rule on Wednesday on whether Scotland’s highest civil court should send a Brexit extension letter on behalf of Boris Johnson if he fails to do so.

Legislation passed last month requires the PM to ask for more time if there is no deal in place by October 19.

His lawyers assured the Court of Session last week that he would abide by the legislation and that was accepted on Monday by Lord Pentland, who ruled that there was “no doubt” Mr Johnson would comply with the so-called Benn Act.

The three anti-Brexit campaigners behind the latest case appealed that decision to the Inner House of the Edinburgh court on Tuesday.
